column4: Hello. One question... On ubuntu, how do i make the OSS-module autoload... So i don't have to modprobe all the time after a sys restart.
So... /lib/modules/[Kernel-name] / i suppose is the right place? But what do i put there for OSS to load without modprobe?
the way it works in 2.6 is that if the hardware is there then it should load - if you have to reprobe something else is the issue
I suppose it may be the fact it loads libALSA instead... So i have to probe OSS when using software only built for using OSS.
so it loads that - hmm so install "bum" and turn off any alsa that is starting
bum is software? Never heard of? apt-get?
I'll try it out. Can you load other modules at boot with it as well?
its less of a module more of a server stuff thing
As long as it can kill ALSA-server and load OSS instead i'm happy.

:-) is it in the list - you can disable it
